intro: Sphalanthus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or greenish, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Sphalanthus parviflorus is adapted to drought conditions and has a low, spreading growth habit.
